name: Lychee Honey
description: Light Floral, Naturally Sweet. Harvested during lychee blossom season with delicate floral aroma. Ideal for daily consumption, tea, and warm water. Rich in antioxidants.

name: Rudilio Honey
description: Forest Floral, Robust, Traditional. Collected from forest regions where Rudilio blossoms grow. Valued for immunity support and seasonal wellness.

name: Churi Honey
description: Rare Mountain-Sourced, Smooth. Harvested from Chiuri tree blossoms in Himalayan foothills. Nutrient-dense and mildly sweet, valued for sustained energy and recovery.

name: Mustard Honey
description: Bold, Sharp, Warming. Harvested from mustard fields and wild mustard plants. Traditionally used for cold weather consumption, digestion, and metabolism.

name: Faffar Honey
description: Dark, Mineral-Rich, Intense. Harvested from buckwheat blossoms. Naturally rich in minerals and antioxidants. Preferred for strength, stamina, and iron-rich diets.

name: Mad Honey
description: High-Altitude, Potent, Rare. Collected from high-altitude Himalayan regions. Known for unique botanical source. Must be consumed responsibly in small quantities.

name: Sisso Honey
description: Woody, Earthy, Forest-Grown. Sourced from Sissoo Indian Rosewood trees. Known for respiratory comfort, seasonal wellness, and strength.

name: Cliff Honey
description: Wild Cliff-Harvested, Traditional. Rare honey harvested from natural hives on steep Himalayan cliffs. Symbol of Himalayan courage and heritage.

name: White Honey
description: Creamy, Mild, Naturally Crystallised. Forms naturally when honey crystallises finely. Loved for mild taste, easy spreading, and children-friendly sweetness.

name: Nauni Bilona Ghee
description: Slow-Churned, Aromatic, Pure. Prepared using traditional bilona method. Made from indigenous cows grazing freely on Himalayan grasses. Preserves natural aroma and digestibility.

name: Organic Grass-Fed Cow Ghee (Illam)
description: Clean, Balanced, Everyday. Sourced from organic pasturelands of Illam. Made from milk of grass-fed cows raised on chemical-free fodder. Mild flavour suited for daily cooking.

name: Yak Ghee A2
description: Rich, Dense, Mountain Nourishment. Crafted from milk of free-roaming Himalayan yaks. Naturally richer and more concentrated than cow ghee. For sustained energy and warmth.

name: Himalayan Sun Activated Shilajit
description: Naturally Activated, Traditional. Slowly sun-dried to preserve natural resin structure. For strength, stamina, and daily vitality routines.

name: Cold-Crafted Shilajit
description: Low-Heat Processed, Clean. Purified using controlled, low-temperature mechanical methods. Maintains mineral integrity without heat damage. For modern wellness use.

name: Traditional Fire-Purified Shilajit
description: Traditionally Refined, Concentrated. Processed using gentle traditional heat methods. For classical preparations and traditional wellness rituals.

name: Marsi Rice
description: Ancient, Cold-Resilient, Rare. Traditionally grown in high Himalayan valleys. Matures slowly, developing rich aroma and dense grain structure for nourishing meals.

name: Chinu Rice
description: Light, Ancient, Climate-Resilient. Traditionally cultivated with minimal water. Light, easy to digest, and naturally resilient. A staple of mountain diets.

name: Kaguno Rice
description: Nutty, Wholesome, Traditional. Traditional millet grown in terraced Himalayan farms. Nutty flavour and slow-growing nature ideal for balanced nourishment.

name: Buckwheat Flour (Faffar Aata)
description: Stone-Ground, Traditional, Pure. Ground from whole buckwheat grains, retaining natural character. Widely used in Himalayan flatbreads and traditional foods.

name: Buckwheat Rice (Faffar Dana)
description: Mountain-Grown, Robust, Mineral-Rich. Cultivated in cold Himalayan regions. Dense, nutrient-rich grains from harsh climates. Traditional high-altitude staple.

name: Dolpa Beans
description: High-Altitude, Protein-Rich, Hardy. Grown in Dolpa's rugged terrain. Mature slowly in cold conditions, resulting in firm texture and deep flavour. Mountain protein source.

name: Jumla Beans
description: Cold-Grown, Dense, Traditional. Cultivated in Jumla's harsh climate. Naturally thick skins and concentrated nutrition through slow growth. Himalayan household staple.

name: Moringa Powder
description: Sun-Dried, Nutrient-Dense, Pure. Sun-dried moringa leaf powder from Himalayan foothills. Minimal processing retains natural nutrition. Daily green superfood.
